info.title: Sendy Public API
info.description:
In order to get started with Sendy Public API, you will need to first register a business account.
Thereafter, login to the Sendy app, create a password and generate a personal access token for API authentication.

This guide details interfaces that allow you to integrate your own apps with Sendy's services.

BearerAuth.description:
We use bearer tokens to authorise requests. These tokens are generated from the sendy app.

Tokens are shown only once upon generation and are not saved. Ensure they are only referenced from environment files and kept safe.

Access is granted by passing an authorization header with the token when sending requests.
Authorization: Bearer <token>

InvalidApiToken.description: The specified resource was not found

status.description: Indication that the intended action didn't execute due to invalid credentials

message.description: Message indicating that the action was unsuccessful due to an invalid access token

UnexpectedError.description: An unexpected error occurred while processing the request

status.description: Indication that the intended action didn't execute due to something unexpected

message.description: User friendly message acknowledging that something went wrong

post.description: Create and store a new password for a corporate account.

cop_id.description: ID representing the corporate account which the client accessing the API belongs to

cop_user_id.description: Corporate ID of the user who is trying to access the API

password.description: The new password the client intends to store

password_confirmation.description: A confirmation of the new password that the client intends to store

status.description: Indicates that the request was processed successfully and the action was executed

message.description: A confirmation message verifying that the action was successfully executed

status.description: Indicates that the request was not processed successfully as validation failed

message.description: A message indicating the field in which the validation failed and the validation failure

post.description: Generates access tokens authorising a corporate account to access the Sendy API.

password.description: The corporate client's password (Configured on the "generate password" endpoint)

status.description: Indicates that the request was processed successfully and the action was executed

token.description: The JWT token that was generated and grants a user access to the Sendy API

message.description: A confirmation message verifying that the tokens were successfully generated

status.description: Indicates that the request was not processed successfully as authentication failed

message.description: An affirmation of failed authentication and an indication of what possibly went wrong

status.description: Indicates that the request was not processed successfully as validation failed

message.description: A message indicating the field in which the validation failed and the validation failure

post.description: Revokes token for the authenticated user and expires it, ensuring it can no longer be used to access the API.

post.description: Facilitates confirmation of an order after getting a quotation from the price request endpoint, using the pricing UUIDs

pricing_uuid.description: A unique string returned from the price request endpoint that identifies the tier quotation

payment_option.description: ID representing the type of payment option you intend to use. Found in the settings endpoint.

carrier_type.description: ID representing the type of carrier you intend to use. Found in the settings endpoint.

destination_paid_status.description: Set to true if order type is "FULFILLMENT_ORDER" or "DEDICATED_ORDER" else will default to false.

note.example: Pick the items at the reception

schedule_time.description: The preffered pickup time for the order. Defaults to the current time.

rider_phone.description: If the value is null. The application will attempt to pair with any available riders.

waypoint_instructions.description: This value to only be included when performing a FULFILLMENT_ORDER.

waypoint_id.description: Waypoint identifier for the drop-off/pick-up point

notes.example: Please call Philip +254717266700 when you get to the pickup location. ADDITIONAL NOTES: Call Liz
notes.description: Additional notes added in order to deliver any necessary information during order placement.

ref_no.description: The ref_no set for the pick-up point has to match (be the same as) the ref_no for the reconciling drop-off point.

tags.name: Access
tags.description: Access endpoints are used to provide ways in which the user can be verified, authenticated and subsequently interact with the Sendy API. Does not require a token.

tags.name: General
tags.description: General endpoints do not provide integration to our services but grant access to resources that are required when integrating.
